Disembrangling Programming

The simple life of a web developer — by Paul Craciunoiu (Resume) (The List)

April 12-16 status

Tags: mozilla, webdev, weekly updates
16 Apr 2010

Last week (April 12-16)

  • kitsune

    • r? cool vim indenting in templates
    • r? minify bug 550515
    • finish converting our current database from latin1 to utf8 after lots of painful dealing with data
    • fix advanced search form logic, deals with default values, validation, cleanup. fixes a few other bugs in the process
    • fix json results and add lots of tests
    • fix search results sorting
    • IT bugs to truncate a table, sync stage db with prod and convert the database to UTF8 according to this bug

  • tiki

    • session fixes required for kitsune integration filed and reviewed
    • fix and review some security vulnerabilities on mobile

This week (April 19-23)

  • kitsune

    • finish the remaining kitsune bugs with the rest of the SUMOdev team
    • finish UTF conversion of the database
    • prepare for kitsune push, potential QA bugs
    • begin work on discussion forums – milestone 2.1
    • install mod_wsgi and run tiki in parallel with kitsune locally
    • discuss/learn more about Test Driven Development

  • tiki

    • finish adding WebTrends to SUMO for tracking

blog comments powered by Disqus

I am currently a software engineer at Humble Bundle, changing digital distribution on the internets.

Until January 2012, I was the Co-founder and CTO of SoWink Inc., a revolutionary social online network that helps you meet new people. Be sure to check out our blog for more details.

Until April 2011, I worked as a web developer for Mozilla, with main focus on Django, Python, and PHP.

I enjoy doing freelance work for other websites, mostly non-profits. If you're interested in my services, contact me through one of the links below.

Follow me -- paul [at] craciunoiu {dot} net -- My GitHub

Success is a journey, not a destination. The doing is often more important than the outcome. — Arthur Robert Ashe, Jr
